title: Introduction to WordPress
description: Learn the basics of WordPress CMS

questions.title: What is WordPress?
questions.explanation: WordPress is a free and open-source content management system (CMS) written in PHP

questions.title: WordPress is open source
questions.explanation: WordPress is released under the GPL license, making it open source software

questions.title: Which language is WordPress written in?
questions.explanation: WordPress is primarily written in PHP, along with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript

questions.title: Select all features of WordPress
questions.explanation: WordPress has a robust plugin system, theme support, and user management. It does not have a built-in compiler

title: Advanced PHP Programming
description: Master advanced PHP concepts and techniques

questions.title: What is a namespace in PHP?

answers.text: A way to organize code and avoid naming conflicts

questions.explanation: Namespaces in PHP provide a way to group related classes, interfaces, functions and constants

questions.title: PHP supports multiple inheritance
questions.explanation: PHP does not support multiple inheritance. However, it supports traits which provide similar functionality

questions.title: Which of these are valid PHP data types?
questions.explanation: PHP supports String, Integer, Array, and Boolean. There is no separate Character type in PHP

questions.title: What does PDO stand for?
questions.explanation: PDO stands for PHP Data Objects, which is a database access layer providing a uniform method of access to multiple databases

title: JavaScript Fundamentals
description: Learn the core concepts of JavaScript

questions.title: JavaScript is a compiled language
questions.explanation: JavaScript is an interpreted language, not a compiled language. It is executed by the browser's JavaScript engine

questions.title: Which keyword is used to declare a constant in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: The 'const' keyword is used to declare constants in JavaScript (ES6+)

questions.title: What does DOM stand for?
questions.explanation: DOM stands for Document Object Model, which is a programming interface for HTML and XML documents

questions.title: Which of these are JavaScript frameworks?
questions.explanation: React, Angular, and Vue.js are JavaScript frameworks. Django and Laravel are Python and PHP frameworks respectively

questions.title: What does SQL stand for?
questions.explanation: SQL stands for Structured Query Language, used for managing relational databases

questions.title: A primary key must be unique
questions.explanation: A primary key must contain unique values and cannot contain NULL values

questions.title: Which of these are types of database relationships?
questions.explanation: The three main types of database relationships are One-to-One, One-to-Many, and Many-to-Many
